dayplanner

Class Time

  • java.lang.Object
    • dayplanner.Time

  • public class Time
extends java.lang.Object
    represents a time object that stores dates.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Time()
      creates a new empty time object.
      Time(int year, int month, int day, int hour, int minute)
      creates a new time object with the given attributes.

      • Time

        public Time(int year,
    int month,
    int day,
    int hour,
    int minute)
        creates a new time object with the given attributes.
        Parameters:
        year - the year of the object ie. (2014).
        month - the month of the object ie. (2).
        day - the day of the object ie. (15).
        hour - the hour of the object ie. (03).
        minute - the minute of the object ie. (56).

      • compareTime

        public int compareTime(Time otherTime)
        Compares two times to see if the first is less than, greater than, or equal to the second.
        Parameters:
        otherTime - the second time in the comparison.
        Returns:
        -1 if the first time (calendar-wise) comes after the second time. 0 if the first time(calendar-wise) comes after the second time. 1 if other is null

        Checks if the time object is empty.
